I've started writing the Todou article on Wikipedia. Here's the current ver=
sion with 
citations.

--------------------
Todo Heisuke (1844 - December 1=
3, 1867) was the eighth unit captain of the 
Shinsengumi.

=3D=3DBackground=
=3D=3D
Todo was from Edo, Musashi Province (now Tokyo). Very little is know=
n about his origin. 
Although he was said to be an illegitimate child of a =
feudal lord, it is debatable. 
(Yamamura, 179-180)

Todo was a practitioner=
 of the Hokushin Itto-ryu, trained at Chiba Shusaku Narimasa's 
dojo. (Yama=
mura, 181) However, according to some sources, he was trained at Ito 
Kashi=
tar?'s dojo instead. (Yamamura, 182)

In around 1862, he started "taking hi=
s meals" at Kondou Isami's Shieikan.(Nagakura, 20
-21)

=3D=3DShinsengumi P=
eriod=3D=3D
In 1863, Todo joined the Roshigumi with Kondo and other members=
 of the Shieikan. 
(Yamamura, 185) After the Shinsengumi was formed, Todo f=
irst became a fukuchou jokin 
(assistant vice commander) and then became th=
e captain of the eighth unit in 1865. 
(Yamamura, 186)

Todo received a wou=
nd on his forehead during the Ikedaya Jiken on July 8, 1864. 
(Yamamura, 17=
7)

=3D=3DDeath=3D=3D
Todo was killed during the Aburakoji Affair on Decemb=
er 13, 1867.(Yamamura, 189)

According to Nagakura Shinpachi's "Shinsengumi=
 Tenmatsuki", Kondo had wished to spare 
Todo's life. (Nagukura, 144) Howev=
er, Todo was killed by a new member, Miura 
Tsunesaburo, whom did not know =
the circumstances. (Nagakura, 145)

--------------------
References
Nagakur=
a, Shinpachi. "Shinsengumi Tenmatsuki". Tokyo; Shin Jinbutsu Oraisha, 1998.=

4404026706

Yamamura, Tatsuya. ''Shinsengumi Kenkyaku-Den''. Tokyo: =
PHP Interface, 1998. ISBN 
4569601766
